definition[0]: a system which makes it easy to buy and sell goods with other countries, because there are few restrictions
example[0]: There is now an open market within the European Community.
definition[1]: a market where foreign competitors are allowed
example[1]: The main aim of the World Trade Organisation is to promote open markets worldwide.
definition[2]: in an open-market action, operation etc, a CENTRAL BANK increases or reduces the MONEY SUPPLY (=the amount of money in the economy)
example[2]: a Federal Reserve open-market operation that injected $1 billion of cash into the banking system
